<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#level_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Level</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string | <a href="#locklevel">Pulumi.<wbr>Azure<wbr>Native.<wbr>Authorization.<wbr>Lock<wbr>Level</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The level of the lock. Possible values are: NotSpecified, CanNotDelete, ReadOnly. CanNotDelete means authorized users are able to read and modify the resources, but not delete. ReadOnly means authorized users can only read from a resource, but they can't modify or delete it.</dd><dt class="property-required property-replacement"
            title="Required">
        <span id="resourcegroupname_csharp">

    </dt>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>

## Supporting Types



<h4 id="locklevel">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The identity that created the resource.</dd><dt class="property-optional"

</div>

## Import



An existing resource can be imported using its type token, name, and identifier, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import azure-native:authorization:ManagementLockAtResourceGroupLevel testlock /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/locks/{lockName} 
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
